title: 8.1.6.2.1.1.1 CDP Programmable Key Authentication Unfreeze Request Data

content.text:
Figure 632 specifies the Request Data for a Personality Unfreeze Request operation using Programmable
Key Authentication (refer to the AUS field in Figure 285).

tables.title: Table_8_1_6_2_1_1_1_CDP_Programmable_Key_Authentication_Unfreeze_Request_Data
tables.table_md:
| Bytes | Description | | :--- | :--- | | 05:00 | CDP Request Data Frame Common Fields (CDPREQUESTDFCF): This field contains the CDP Request Data Frame common fields (refer to Figure 630) with the CDP Request Message Type field set to a value of 1h (i.e., Personality Unfreeze Request). | | 06 | Personality Identifier (PERID): This field specifies the Personality Identifier this operation is targeting (refer to Figure 447). | | 07 | CDP Authentication Method Identifier (CDPAMI): This field specifies the CDP Authentication Method Identifier value of 02h (refer to the AUS field in Figure 285). | | 08 | CDP Authentication Algorithm (CDPAA): This field specifies the keyed-hash algorithm being used (refer to the CDPALG field in Figure 328).
This field contains the value that represents the position of the corresponding bit in the CDPALG bitmask (e.g., a value of 0h corresponds to the HMAC-SHA-384 algorithm). | | Bytes | Description | | 10:09 | Random Nonce Size (RANDNS): This field specifies the size in bytes of the nonce in the RANDN field. | | (RANDNS+10):11 | Random Nonce (RANDN): This field specifies the value of the random nonce generated by the controller (refer to section 8.1.6.3.2). | | (RANDNS+11) | HMAC Size (HMACS): This field specifies the size in bytes of the HMAC in the HMACV field.
The size of the HMAC should be the size of the keyed-hash algorithm message digest size (refer to NIST FIPS 180-4) used by the CDP Authentication Algorithm (e.g., if HMAC-SHA-384 is supported, then the value of this field is the size of the SHA-384 message digest, i.e., 48 bytes). | | (HMACS+RANDNS+12): (RANDNS+12) | HMAC Value (HMACV): This field specifies the value of the HMAC (refer to section 8.1.6.2.2). |
